Bay Area Open Science Group
A virtual community for Stanford, UCSF, UC Berkeley and beyond

2021-2022 Meetings

Date Title Presenter Summary
9/28/21 Getting to Know the Bay Area Open Science Group
 BAOSG Facilitators Discussion of the purpose of the group and shared approaches to open science
10/26/21 Curating a COVID-19 Data Repository Tiffany Tang (Berkeley) Lessons learned creating open-source public data repository of COVID-19 data
11/30/21 Open Peer Review Mario Maliƒçki (Stanford) Discussion of impact of peer review and move towards structured peer review
1/25/22 Project Based Training in Reproducible Methods for Undergraduates Adrienne Mueller (Stanford) Lessons from Stanford Cardiovascular Institute pilot "Rigor and Reproducibility Side-Projects" initiative mentoring undergraduate students in four meta-research projects using open science methods
2/22/22 Innovating Education in Reproductive Health Biftu Mengesha (UCSF) Open curricula and educational resources for sexual and reproductive health
3/22/22 Improving Science Communication Milo Johnson (UC Berkeley) Ongoing project to make scientific papers more interactive through "clickable depth"
4/26/22 Archiving the COVID Tracking Project Kevin Miller (UCSF) Discussion of Covid Tracking Project and archiving considerations for data, repository and group project management
5/24/22 UC Berkeley Open Source Science Group Rachel Clune, Orion Cohen, Tarini Hardikar, and Connie Robinson (UC Berkeley)
 Discussion of evolving graduate student led open source skills course
6/28/22 COVID-19 RCTs John Borghi (Stanford) Lane Medical Library project on randomized controlled trials literature for COVID-related drugs
